The song of songs, which <FI>is<Fi> Solomon's.<CM>
Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love <FI>is<Fi> better than wine.<RF>thy…: Heb. thy loves<Rf>
Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name <FI>is as<Fi> ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.<RF>the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly<Rf>
I <FI>am<Fi> black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

Look not upon me, because I <FI>am<Fi> black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; <FI>but<Fi> mine own vineyard have I not kept.<CM>

Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest <FI>thy flock<Fi> to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?<RF>as one…: or, as one that is veiled<Rf>
If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds' tents.
I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
Thy cheeks are comely with rows <FI>of jewels<Fi>, thy neck with chains <FI>of gold<Fi>.
We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.<CM>
While the king <FI>sitteth<Fi> at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
A bundle of myrrh <FI>is<Fi> my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
My beloved <FI>is<Fi> unto me <FI>as<Fi> a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.<RF>camphire: or, cypress<Rf>
Behold, thou <FI>art<Fi> fair, my love; behold, thou <FI>art<Fi> fair; thou <FI>hast<Fi> doves' eyes.<RF>my love: or, my companion<Rf>
Behold, thou <FI>art<Fi> fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed <FI>is<Fi> green.
The beams of our house <FI>are<Fi> cedar, <FI>and<Fi> our rafters of fir.<RF>rafters: or, galleries<Rf><CM>
